hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Induced Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp liquidity gap down (>3% in 1 hour) following negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines), a mean reversion bounce of 1.5-2.5% occurs within 4 hours as algorithmic liquidity providers refill the order book, provided the broader regime remains NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Algorithmic market makers pull liquidity during news shocks, creating exaggerated moves. In NEUTRAL regimes (not structural bear), they redeploy capital quickly to capture spreads, creating predictable bounce patterns. Recent 'structural shift' narrative suggests liquidity providers are sensitive but reactive.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes >3% below previous close
Negative macro news headline timestamp within past 90 minutes (keyword detection: 'crisis', 'crash', 'regulat*')
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such events continue declining beyond 2.5% below entry point within the 4-hour window, indicating structural liquidity withdrawal rather than temporary gap.
